Html: I'd like to have these references and the WinForms controls moved into a separate assembly, please. Sound is not intrinsically visible to human eye, after all (and not all projects contain references to WinForms ;))

After looking at the code, I came to think that it is better to create a proper "Strategy" class for each member of the WaveCallbackStrategy enum, and remove WaveCallbackInfo class entirely. Then you can move UserControls and Windows into a separate assembly once the audio playback/recording related classes (non visual stuff ;)) are freed from WinForms dependencies.
yes, I would like to move the WinForms suff out in the future. But it shouldn't stop you using NAudio in a non WinForms context.
It's working fine in my non-WinForms project, thanks for commenting on my request ^^
I would like to see these references added as part of the NuGet package(s), since they're required. It took me a long time to figure out why an Azure deployment was failing because of this :(
@tommck, what class in NAudio were you using that needed WinForms in Azure?
